title: Change Recipes
description: Step-by-step guides to switch to digital independence

recipes.title: Firefox Browser

prep.content:
Visit [mozilla.org/firefox](https://www.mozilla.org/firefox/)
- Download the version for your system
- Install Firefox

On the first start, Firefox offers to import bookmarks and passwords
- Select your previous browser
- Confirm the import

Sign in with a Firefox account (optional)
- Adjust privacy settings
- Install useful add-ons like uBlock Origin

Firefox asks on the first start if it should be the default browser
- Or: System Settings → Default Apps → Web Browser

recipes.dessert:
**Sync**: With a Firefox account, you can synchronize bookmarks, passwords, and tabs between devices.

**Containers**: Firefox offers "Multi-Account Containers" to separate different identities (private, work, shopping).
recipes.conclusion:
- **Tracking Protection**: Blocks many trackers by default
- **Open Source**: The source code is publicly viewable
- **Independent**: Firefox is developed by the non-profit Mozilla Foundation
- **Extensions**: Wide selection of privacy add-ons available
recipes.description: Switch to Firefox - the independent and privacy-friendly browser

recipes.title: Posteo & Mailbox.org

prep.content:
Visit [posteo.de](https://posteo.de)
- Click "Create Posteo Account"
- Choose an email address (€1/month)

Posteo accepts anonymous payments (cash, transfer)
- No personal data required

Use the web interface or set up an email client
- IMAP: posteo.de:993 (SSL/TLS)
- SMTP: posteo.de:465 (SSL/TLS)

Visit [mailbox.org](https://mailbox.org)
- Choose a plan (from €1/month)
- Create your account

Calendar and contacts included
- Office suite available
- PGP encryption possible

recipes.dessert:
**Migration**: Both providers offer tools to import emails from other mailboxes.

**Encryption**: Use PGP for end-to-end encrypted emails.
recipes.conclusion:
- **Privacy**: Servers in Germany, GDPR compliant
- **Sustainable**: Both use renewable energy
- **No Ads**: Ad-free and tracker-free
- **Additional Features**: Calendar, contacts, cloud storage
recipes.description: Switch to German, privacy-friendly email providers

ingredients.content: An account for example at Posteo.de (green, secure, anonymous), Mailbox.org, Proton.me (from Switzerland, strong encryption) or Tuta (consistently encrypted, from Hannover).

recipes.title: WhatsApp to Signal

prep.content:
Download Signal from the App Store (iOS) or Google Play Store (Android)
- Or visit [signal.org](https://signal.org) for desktop versions

Open Signal and enter your phone number
- Confirm your number with the SMS code

Add a name and profile picture
- Adjust your privacy settings

Signal automatically finds contacts who already use Signal
- Inform your important contacts about the switch

recipes.dessert:
**Transfer Groups**: Recreate your important WhatsApp groups in Signal and invite members.

**Backup**: Signal offers encrypted backups for your chats. Enable this feature in settings.
recipes.conclusion:
- **End-to-End Encryption**: All messages are encrypted by default
- **No Ads**: Signal is completely ad-free
- **Open Source**: The source code is publicly viewable
- **Donation-Funded**: Signal is funded by donations, not data sales
recipes.description: Switch from WhatsApp to Signal - the secure and privacy-friendly alternative

recipes.title: Google to Ecosia

prep.content:
Visit [ecosia.org](https://www.ecosia.org)
- Click "Add Ecosia to [Browser]"
- Confirm the installation

**Chrome/Edge**: Settings → Search engine → Select Ecosia
- **Firefox**: Settings → Search → Default search engine → Ecosia
- **Safari**: Settings → Search → Ecosia

Download the Ecosia app from the App Store or Google Play Store
- Or use Ecosia in your mobile browser

recipes.dessert:
**Search History**: Ecosia does not permanently store your search queries. After one week, all data is anonymized.

**Transparency**: On the Ecosia website, you can see exactly how many trees have been planted.
recipes.conclusion:
- **80% of Profits for Tree Planting**: Ecosia invests most of its profits in reforestation projects
- **Carbon Negative**: Ecosia removes more CO₂ from the atmosphere than it causes
- **Privacy**: No data sales to third parties
- **Transparent Financial Reports**: Monthly publication of all income and expenses
recipes.description: Switch from Google to Ecosia - the search engine that plants trees

recipes.title: Mastodon

prep.content:
Visit [joinmastodon.org/servers](https://joinmastodon.org/servers)
- Choose a server based on your interests or region
- Recommendation for German-speaking users: mastodon.social, chaos.social

Click "Sign Up" on your chosen server
- Enter username, email, and password
- Confirm your email address

Add a profile picture and header
- Write a short bio
- Link your website or other profiles

Search for hashtags that interest you
- Follow interesting accounts
- Use the local and federated timeline for discovery

recipes.dessert:
**Apps**: There are many apps for Mastodon - e.g. Tusky (Android), Ivory (iOS), or use the web interface.

**Migration**: You can move to another server later and take your followers with you.
recipes.conclusion:
- **Decentralized**: No single company controls the network
- **Chronological Timeline**: No algorithmic sorting
- **Open Source**: The code is publicly viewable
- **No Ads**: Funded by donations and volunteers
- **Privacy**: You decide who can see your posts
recipes.description: Switch to Mastodon - the decentralized social network

recipes.title: Local Bookstore

prep.content:
Search for bookstores in your area
- Many offer online ordering with pickup
- Support local businesses and jobs

**buch7.de**: Donates 75% of profits to social projects
- **genialokal.de**: Mediates to local bookstores
- **Thalia, Hugendubel**: German book retail chains

**medimops.de**: Used books, movies, games
- **booklooker.de**: Marketplace for used books
- Local second-hand stores

recipes.dessert:
**Library**: Use your local library - many also offer e-book lending.

**Reading Circles**: Exchange books with friends or join a reading circle.
recipes.conclusion:
- **Local Economy**: Supports local jobs
- **Expert Advice**: Personal book recommendations from staff
- **Sustainability**: Shorter shipping distances, less packaging
- **Fair Working Conditions**: Better conditions than large online retailers
recipes.description: Support local bookstores instead of Amazon
